name: Li Ming
bio: Li Ming is a highly skilled chef with over 12 years of experience cooking traditional Chinese dishes. He is known for his mastery of spicy dishes like Kung Pao Chicken and Sichuan Beef Noodles.

recipes.name: Gong Bao Chicken
recipes.description: A classic Sichuan dish with chicken, peanuts, and chili peppers.
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Cut the chicken into small cubes and marinate in soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and cornstarch for 15 minutes. 2. Heat oil in a wok and stir-fry the chicken until cooked through. 3. Add the garlic, ginger, chili peppers, and peanuts and stir-fry for another minute. 4. Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Hot and Sour Soup
recipes.description: A classic soup with a balance of hot and sour flavors.
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Bring chicken broth to a boil and add the mushrooms, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and chili garlic sauce. 2. Dissolve cornstarch in a little bit of water and add it to the soup to thicken. 3. Beat the eggs in a small bowl and slowly pour them into the soup while stirring. 4. Add the bamboo shoots and tofu and cook for another 2-3 minutes. 5. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Szechuan Beef
recipes.description: A spicy and flavorful beef stir-fry with Szechuan peppercorns.
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Cut the beef into thin strips and marinate in soy sauce, rice wine, cornstarch, and crushed Szechuan peppercorns for 15 minutes. 2. Heat oil in a wok and stir-fry the beef until browned. 3. Add the garlic, ginger, and vegetables and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes. 4. Serve with steamed rice.
